div.head: TO THE RIGHT Honourable VVILLIAM Earle of Hertford, &c.
div.p:
THe long experience, I have had of your Honours favourable intentions towards me, hath compell'd me to this Presumption. But I hope your Goodnesse will be pleased to pardon what your Benignity was the cause of, viz. the errour of my Dedication. Had your Candor not encourag'd me, in this I had beene innocent: Yet (I beseech you) thinke not, I intend it any other, then your Recreation at your retirement from your
weighty Employments; and to be the Declaration of your gracious encouragements towards me, and the testimony of my Gratitude. If the publicke view of the world entertayn it with no lesse welcome, then that private one of the Stage already has given it, I shall be glad the World owes you the Thankes: If it meet with too severe Construction, I hope your Protection.
